description: SQL injection vulnerability in login form allows attackers to bypass authentication by injecting malicious SQL code
Reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in search parameter allows injection of malicious JavaScript
SSL certificate validation disabled allowing man-in-the-middle attacks to intercept encrypted communications
Broken access control allows unauthorized users to access sensitive data through direct URL manipulation
Default administrative credentials not changed, allowing easy unauthorized system access
Server-side request forgery allows attackers to make requests to internal network resources
Insecure deserialization of user-controlled data leads to remote code execution
Weak password policy allows brute force attacks on user accounts
Missing security logging prevents detection of unauthorized access attempts
Sensitive customer data transmitted over unencrypted HTTP connection
SQL injection in product search functionality allows database content extraction
Stored XSS in user comments section executes malicious scripts for all visitors
Expired SSL certificate cannot be validated, exposing communications to interception
IDOR vulnerability allows users to access other users' private data by changing URL parameters
Directory listing enabled exposes sensitive configuration files to unauthorized users
SSRF in image upload feature allows scanning of internal network infrastructure
Deserialization of untrusted data in session management leads to privilege escalation
No account lockout mechanism allows unlimited password guessing attempts
Security events not logged, preventing forensic analysis of security incidents
API keys and database credentials exposed in client-side JavaScript code
